net.fathomsoft.nova.util

Class SyntaxUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.fathomsoft.nova.util.SyntaxUtils

  • public class SyntaxUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used for getting information about the Syntax of Nova.

                                                       java.lang.String type2)

        Parameters:
        type1 - The first primitive type to check.
        type2 - The second primitive type to check.
        Returns:
        The higher ranked primitive type of the two given.

        Find the next available dot operator index within the given String.
        Parameters:
        str - The String to find the dot operator within.
        Returns:
        The index of the dot operator. If a dot operator is not found, then -1 is returned instead.

      • findCharInBaseScope

        public static int findCharInBaseScope(java.lang.String haystack,
                                      char needle)
        Find the next available instance of the given character in the base scope of the given haystack String. The base scope means outside of any quotes, parenthesis, and/or brackets.
        Parameters:
        haystack - The String to find the character within.
        needle - The character to search for in the String.
        Returns:
        The index of the character. If the character is not found, then -1 is returned instead.

      • findCharInBaseScope

        public static int findCharInBaseScope(java.lang.String haystack,
                                      char needle,
                                      int start)
        Find the next available instance of the given character in the base scope of the given haystack String. The base scope means outside of any quotes, parenthesis, and/or brackets.
        Parameters:
        haystack - The String to find the character within.
        needle - The character to search for in the String.
        start - The index to start the search at.
        Returns:
        The index of the character. If the character is not found, then -1 is returned instead.

      • findCharInBaseScope

        public static int findCharInBaseScope(java.lang.String haystack,
                                      char[] needles,
                                      int start)
        Find the next available instance of the given character in the base scope of the given haystack String. The base scope means outside of any quotes, parenthesis, and/or brackets.
        Parameters:
        haystack - The String to find the character within.
        needles - The characters to search for in the String.
        start - The index to start the search at.
        Returns:
        The index of the character. If the character is not found, then -1 is returned instead.

      • getLiteralTypeName

        public static java.lang.String getLiteralTypeName(java.lang.String literal)
        Get the class name of the type that the literal value implies.

        For example: "this is a String literal" would return "String" because String is the class name of the String literal type.
        Parameters:
        literal - The literal to find the type name of.
        Returns:
        The class name of the type that the literal value implies.

      • isLiteral

        public static boolean isLiteral(java.lang.String value)
        Get whether or not the given String value represents one of the following:
        • String literal
        • Character literal
        • Number literal
        Parameters:
        value - The String of text to validate.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the given String value represents a literal.

      • isCharLiteral

        public static boolean isCharLiteral(java.lang.String value)
        Get whether or not the given String value represents a character literal. A character literal consists of a a single character surrounded by single quotes.

        Possible inputs:
        • 'a'
        • '2'
        • '%'
        • '/'
        Parameters:
        value - The String of text to validate.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the String represents a character literal.

      • isStringLiteral

        public static boolean isStringLiteral(java.lang.String value)
        Get whether or not the given String value represents a String literal. A String literal consists of a collection of characters surrounded by double quotes.

        Possible inputs:
        • "This is + asdf-523$#$%#4 a String input"
        • "123123123"
        • "More string inputs"
        • "\"Fake quotes around it.\""
        Parameters:
        value - The String of text to validate.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the String represents a String literal.

      • isPrimitiveType

        public static boolean isPrimitiveType(java.lang.String type)
        Get whether the specified type is primitive.

        Primitive types include:
        • int
        • char
        • long_long (aka long)
        • boolean
        • short
        • float
        • double
        • void (lightly)
        Parameters:
        type - The type to check.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the type is primitive.

      • isVariableAssignment

        public static boolean isVariableAssignment(java.lang.String statement)
        Get whether or not the given String is a valid variable assignment. Assignments contain an identifier or array access on the left hand side of the assignment, and anything that returns a value on the right hand side.

        For example: 
         variable_NAME1 = (getSize() + 5) / array[index]
        Parameters:
        statement - The String of text to validate.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the given String is a valid variable assignment.

      • isValidIdentifier

        public static boolean isValidIdentifier(java.lang.String value)
        Get whether or not the given String is a valid identifier. Identifiers can contain characters of the following types:
        • A-Z
        • a-z
        • 0-9
        • The '_' character (underscore)
        It should also be noted that numbers cannot start an identifier.
        Parameters:
        value - The String of text to validate.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the given String is a valid identifier.

      • isValidIdentifierAccess

        public static boolean isValidIdentifierAccess(java.lang.String value)
        Get whether or not the given String is a valid identifier access.

        For example: "getName().publicVarName.methodName().var[72]"
        Parameters:
        value - The String of text to validate.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the given String is a valid identifier access.

         variableName[index]
        Parameters:
        value - The statement to test.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the given statement is an array access.

        public static boolean isMethodCall(java.lang.String statement)

         containingInstance.methodName(arguments, arguments, ..., arguments)
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Whether or not the given statement is a method call.

        For example: 
         new dataType[size]...[size]
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • findInnerParenthesesBounds

        public static Bounds findInnerParenthesesBounds(Node parent,
                                                java.lang.String statement)
        Calculate the Bounds of the data that is within the parentheses in the given statement.
        Parameters:
        parent - The node to throw an error with if anything goes wrong.
        statement - The statement containing parentheses.
        Returns:
        The bounds of the data within the parentheses.

      • calculateArrayDimensions

        public static int calculateArrayDimensions(java.lang.String statement,
                                           boolean contentPossible)
        Calculate the number of dimensions that the given array has, if any.

        For example: 
         int array[][][] = new int[5][6][7];
        The above array declaration has three dimensions. In essence, the number of dimensions is the amount of brackets that the array variable declaration contains.

        However, you need to pass only one part of the above code example. Either pass the declaration, or the instantiation, or else the number of dimensions will be counted twice.
        Parameters:
        statement - The statement to find the number of dimensions from.
        contentPossible - Whether or not content is allowed to exist within the set of brackets.
        Returns:
        The number of dimensions that the given array has, if any.

      • calculateArrayDimensions

        public static int calculateArrayDimensions(java.lang.String statement,
                                           int start,
                                           boolean contentPossible)
        Calculate the number of dimensions that the given array has, if any.

        For example: 
         int array[][][] = new int[5][6][7];
        The above array declaration has three dimensions. In essence, the number of dimensions is the amount of brackets that the array variable declaration contains.

        However, you need to pass only one part of the above code example. Either pass the declaration, or the instantiation, or else the number of dimensions will be counted twice.
        Parameters:
        statement - The statement to find the number of dimensions from.
        start - The index to start the search at.
        contentPossible - Whether or not content is allowed to exist within the set of brackets.
        Returns:
        The number of dimensions that the given array has, if any.

      • isMainMethod

        public static boolean isMainMethod(BodyMethodDeclaration methodDeclaration)
        Get whether or not the given Method is a valid main method. The main method has the method header as the following: 
         public static void main(String args[])
 {
        ...
 }
        Parameters:
        methodDeclaration - The Method instance to validate.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the given Method is a valid main method.

      • checkVolatile

        public static void checkVolatile(Variable variable)
        Check to see if the given Variable needs to be set as volatile to retain its value after a throw statement has been thrown.
        Parameters:
        variable - The Variable to check.

      • isInstantiation

        public static boolean isInstantiation(java.lang.String statement)
        Get whether or not the given statement is an instantiation. For more details on what an instantiation consists of see Instantiation.decodeStatement(Node, String, Location, boolean).
        Parameters:
        statement - The statement to test.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the given statement is an instantiation.

      • validateMethodAccess

        public static void validateMethodAccess(Identifier accessor,
                                        MethodDeclaration accessed,
                                        Node parent)
        Validate that the given MethodDeclaration can be accessed through the given Identifier accessor.
        Parameters:
        accessor - The Identifier that is accessing the method.
        accessed - The MethodDeclaration that was accessed.
        parent - The parent to use as the context for the error, if one happens.

      • getClassType

        public static ClassDeclaration getClassType(ClassDeclaration reference,
                                            java.lang.String identifierAccess)
        Get the ClassDeclaration that contains the accessed identifier. For more information on what an identifierAccess looks like, see isValidIdentifierAccess(String).
        Parameters:
        reference - The ClassDeclaration context that the identifier was accessed from.
        identifierAccess - The trace of the identifier that was accessed.
        Returns:
        The ClassDeclaration that contains the accessed identifier.

      • getIdentifierName

        public static java.lang.String getIdentifierName(java.lang.String access)
        Get the identifier name that is represented by the given access String variable.

        For example:
        • testName() returns testName
        • arrayAccess[54] returns arrayAccess
        • idName32 returns idName32
        • methodCall (String name, int args) returns methodCall
        Parameters:
        access - The identifier access to get the identifier name from.
        Returns:
        The name of the identifier from given access String.

        public static java.lang.String formatText(java.lang.String text)
        Format the text to follow syntactical rules.
        Parameters:
        text - The String to format.
        Returns:
        The formatted version of the String.

      • isVisible

        public static boolean isVisible(Identifier accessor,
                                InstanceDeclaration declaration)
        Get whether or not the declaration is accessible from the given accessor context.
        Parameters:
        accessor - The Identifier that is accessing the type.
        declaration - The declaration of the type that is being accessed.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the declaration is accessible from the given accessor context.

      • autoboxPrimitive

        public static Instantiation autoboxPrimitive(Value primitive)
        Try to autobox the given primitive Node, if it truly has a primitive value. If the given Value does not have a primitive type, then null is returned.
        Parameters:
        primitive - The Value to try to autobox.
        Returns:
        An instantiation from the corresponding primitive wrapper class. If the given value is not primitive, then null is returned.

      • isValidType

        public static boolean isValidType(Value value,
                                  java.lang.String type)
        Check whether or not the given type is valid within the context of the given Value.

        For example: 
         NonExistingType varName;
        In the example above, "NonExistingType" is not an existing Class and is therefore not a valid type.
        Parameters:
        value - The Value to use as the context in which the type is being declared.
        type - The type to be tested.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the given type is valid.

      • validateCompatibleTypes

        public static boolean validateCompatibleTypes(Value value1,
                                              Value value2)
        Check whether or not the two given values are compatible through comparison or arithmetic.
        Parameters:
        value1 - The first Value to check.
        value2 - The second Value to check.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the two given values are compatible through comparison or arithmetic.

      • getTypeInCommon

        public static ClassDeclaration getTypeInCommon(Value value1,
                                               Value value2)
        Get the base class type that the two Values have in common. If the two nodes do not have anything in common, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        value1 - The first Value to check.
        value2 - The second Value to check.
        Returns:
        The ClassDeclaration instance that the two Values have in common. If they have nothing in common, null is returned.

      • getTypeInCommon

        public static java.lang.String getTypeInCommon(Program context,
                                               java.lang.String type1,
                                               java.lang.String type2)
        Get the type in common between the two given types.
        Parameters:
        context - The program that the two types are located in.
        type1 - The first type to compare.
        type2 - The second type to compare.
        Returns:
        The type in common between the two types. If there is no type in common, null is returned.

      • isTypeCompatible

        public static boolean isTypeCompatible(Program context,
                                       java.lang.String required,
                                       java.lang.String given)
        Check to see if the 'given' type is compatible with the required type.
        Parameters:
        context - The program that the two types are located in.
        required - The type that the 'given' type is required to be compatible with.
        given - The given type to check against the required type.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the two types are compatible.

      • isTypeCompatible

        public static boolean isTypeCompatible(Value required,
                                       Value given)
        Check to see if the 'given' type is compatible with the required type.
        Parameters:
        required - The type that the 'given' type is required to be compatible with.
        given - The given type to check against the required type.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the two types are compatible.

        public static boolean isImported(FileDeclaration file,
                                 java.lang.String clazz)
        Check to see if the FileDeclaration already has the given class imported or not.
        Parameters:
        file - The File to check to see whether or not has the class imported.
        clazz - The class to see if the File has imported.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the File already has the given class imported.

      • validateImported

        public static boolean validateImported(Node node,
                                       java.lang.String clazz)
        Validate that given class has been imported by the given node's FileDeclaration.
        Parameters:
        node - The node that needs to validate that the class has been imported.
        clazz - The class to check to see if has been imported.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the class has been imported.

      • validateImported

        public static boolean validateImported(Node node,
                                       java.lang.String clazz,
                                       Location location)
        Validate that given class has been imported by the given node's FileDeclaration.
        Parameters:
        node - The node that needs to validate that the class has been imported.
        clazz - The class to check to see if has been imported.
        location - The location to point the error at if the class has not been imported.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the class has been imported.

      • isBasicType

        public static boolean isBasicType(java.lang.String type)
        Check to see if the type is a basic type and does not have a class to represent it.
        Parameters:
        type - The type to check.
        Returns:
        Whether or not it is a basic type.
